notes: Often sold as King fish. Surmai in North/West India.
Good for frying. Distinct from Silver Pomfret.
Very common and affordable. Rich in Omega-3.
Popular for fish curry and fry.
Small fish, often fried crispy or dried.
Available in various sizes. 'Tiger prawns' are large.
Mud crabs are popular in some regions.
Highly prized, delicate flesh. Great for steaming or frying.
Very popular freshwater fish in North and East India.
Fast growing, large freshwater fish. Good for curry.
King of fish in Bengal. Known as Pulasa in Andhra Godavari region.
Popular versatile fish. Good for diverse cooking styles.
State fish of Kerala. Famous for 'Karimeen Pollichathu'.
Delicate, white flesh. Mangalore 'Kane Rava Fry' is famous.
Premium fish, excellent taste and texture. High demand.
Premium fish with thick, flaky meat. Iconic 'Bhetki Paturi' in Bengal.
Dark meat, very distinct taste. Rich in protein.
Long, predatory fish. Tasty firm flesh.
Flat fish, usually skinned and fried.
Prized freshwater fish, often considered medicinal.
No scales, single bone (mostly). Distinct earthy taste.
Soft, gelatinous fish. Famous in Mumbai (Bombil Fry).
Small, pinkish fish. Very common and tasty.
Shellfish. Famous in North Kerala cuisine.
